results.title: The World of the artist: three paintings by Hieronymus Bosch
results.creator_credit: George Jacobson, J.H. Lenauer, Mavis Lyons and Filmmakers
results.brief_description: “The Adoration of the Kings”, “The Mocking of the Christ” and “Ecce Homo” are the three paintings of the Flemish artist Bosch simply and carefully analysed. Excellent color and absence of dramatisation distinguish this short art film. The three paintings are in the Johnson Collection in the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

results.title: The World of PVC
results.creator_credit: Bob Kellett, John G. Berry, British Geo Ltd and Dormar Productions
results.brief_description: PVC is the most versatile plastic of all and thiis film is about the process and manufacture of PVC. Tells about its low maintenance and long-lasting protective function. Some if its uses include: 33 1/3 records, raincoats, floor coverings, wallets and briefcases, covers for barges, car and haystacks, and pipes for building industry. PVC is made from oil and coal.

results.title: The World of CRA
results.brief_description: Views of the varied interests of the group of companies associated with Conzinc Riotinto of Australia. Mining iron at Hamersley; lead, silver and zinc at Broken Hill; aluminium at Weipa; uranium at Rum Jungle; and mineral sands at North Stradbroke Island. Treatment of ores, refining of metals, research and exploration in Australia and New Guinea. Intended to replace the film “Mineral Heritage”, released 1965. Shows Australia’s abundant wealth in minerals, and the part C.R.A plays in mining and processing them. Shows the continuing search for new deposits, especially around Papua and New Guinea and in Bass Strait, and research into the potential of the minerals.

results.title: The World of cashmere
results.creator_credit: Frederick Goode, Lionel Hoare and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The story of cashmere wool from the combing of the strands from the goat’s fleeces in the Himalayas, where the animals are reared to the making of knitted goods at Hawick in Scotland. Concentrates on the manufacturing processes, particularly dyeing, emphasizing the care that is taken throughout to maintain quality.

results.title: The World Meteorological Organization
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, V.R. Sarma and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: Its Charter and Organization”.
Traces the history of the World meteorological Organization - a Genva based Specialised Agency of the United Nations. Describes the activities and functions of the organization and explains its role as a co-ordinating body in study of weather phenomena.

results.title: The World is rich
results.creator_credit: Paul Rotha and Films of Fact
results.brief_description: A documentary using footage from around the world, shot over a 30 year period. It shows that the world’s potential food resources are sufficient to supply the world population with an adequate diet. Anarchy in production and distribution, outdated and wasteful agricultural methods, black marketing and food speculation in food are causing famine in many countries, while in others “surplus” food is stored unused or burned. Illustrates how, given a sane economic system, food distribution and production could be geared to the actual needs of the entire world population.

results.title: The World Health Organization at work
results.brief_description: The work of the United Nations World Health Organization in the battle against disease. Tuberculosis was the cause of many deaths in Istanbul, but the government lacked the resources to attack the problem. The World Heath Organization assisted the government to set up a model demonstration and training centre for the fight against the disease. In Israel the WHO is helping to control the spread of rabies. In the desert area around the United States Mexican border an epidemic of rabies broke out, meaning cattle as well as people. With help and advice from the WHO, experienced hunters and trappers were sent out to trap the rabid animals.
